ARABIC: وَيَقُولُ ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ أَءِذَا مَا مِتُّ لَسَوْفَ أُخْرَجُ حَيًّا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Man says, 'When I am dead, will I then be brought out again alive?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Yet man says: "When I am dead, will I come to life again?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Man is prone to say: "Shall I be raised to life after I die?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: The human being says, "Shall I be brought to life again after I will die?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And says man, “When I am dead, will I soon be brought forth alive?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And man says: "When I am dead, shall I then be raised up alive"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And says man: What! when I am dead shall I truly be brought forth alive?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Man says, 'What, when I am dead shall I then be brought forth alive?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And man saith: When I am dead, shall I forsooth be brought forth alive?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Man asks, "When I am once dead, shall I be raised to life?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And man saith: when I am daed, Shall I be presently brought forth alive. *Chapter: 19
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Man says, ‘What? Shall I be brought forth alive [from the grave], when I have been dead?’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Man says: "What! When I am dead, shall I then be raised up alive?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And man (the disbeliever) says: "When I am dead, shall I then be raised up alive?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: The human says: 'What, when I am dead, shall I be raised to life'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And the human being says, “When I am dead, will I be brought back alive?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And the disbeliever says, "When I have died, am I going to be brought forth alive?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [19:66] And man, the denier of the Resurrection — namely, Ubayy b. Khalaf or al-Walīd b. al-Mughīra, concerning whom the verse was revealed — says, ‘When (read a-idha, either pronouncing the second hamza, or not, but inserting an alif between the two [hamzas] in both [readings]) I am dead, shall I then be brought forth alive?’, from the grave, as Muhammad (s) says? (the interrogative [here] statement is meant as a denial, in other words [he means to say] I shall not be brought forth alive after death; mā [of mā mittu, ‘I am dead’] is extra, for emphasis, likewise [extra is] the lām [of la-sawfa, ‘shall I then’]). He [God] then responds to him with the following saying [of His], exalted be He:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And man) i.e. Ubayy Ibn Khalaf al-Jumahi, in denial of the resurrection, (saith: When I am dead, shall I forsooth be brought forth alive) from the grave after I die? This will never be.
